dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE OVER ACTION... "NOVEMBER 12, 1975
dialogues.text: ... The club itself resembles a large unemptied trash-can The boxing ring is extra small to insure constant battle. The lights overhead have barely enough wattage to see who fighting. In the ring are two heavyweights, one white the other bla The white fighter is ROCKY BALBOA.  He is thirty years ol His face is scarred and thick around the nose... His blac hair shines and hangs in his eyes.  Rocky fights in a plodding, machine-like style.  The BLACK FIGHTER dances a bangs combinations into Rocky's face with great accuracy. But the punches do not even cause Rocky to blink... He gr at his opponent and keeps grinding ahead. The people at ringside sit on folding chairs and clamor f blood... They lean out of their seats and heckle the figh In the thick smoke they resemble spectres.  Everyone is hustling bets... The action is even heavier in the balcon A housewife yells for somebody to cover a two dollar bet. The BELL RINGS and the fighters return to their corner... Somebody heaves a beer can into the ring. The Black Fighter spits something red in a bucket and sne across the ring at Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cornerman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm gonna bust his head wide open! In Rocky's corner he is being assisted by a shriveled, balding CORNERMAN, who is an employee of the club... He works on Rocky without any enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lackluster)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ya waltzin' -- Give the suckers some action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overriding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya movin' like a bum -- Want some advice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Just gimme the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGHT FAN rushes up to Rocky... He is sixty-five, with yellow teeth and wearing sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I bet the fight don't go the distance -- Ya feel strong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ya want some good advice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I just want the mouthpiece. The BELL RINGS... Rocky makes the sign of the cross.  The fighters engage in battle.  The other fighter grabs Rocky a clinch and purposely butts him... The butt opens a blee cut on the corner of Rocky's eye. Rocky becomes furious over the foul and drives a flurry i the man's body... Rocky slams the man on the jaw and the fighter is out for the night.  The fans throw rubbish int the ring.  Rocky ignores it. The fans loudly go about collecting bets.  The referee do not bother to even count the fighter out and drags him un the ropes where he is placed on a stretcher.  Two new fighters enter the ring.  Rocky slips on a tattered robe. Embroidered clumsily on the back is, "The Italian Stallio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winner, Rocky Balboa -- Next a six rounder between local lightweights. Without pomp Rocky climbs out of the ring and bums a cigarette from a spectator... The fighter on the stretche passes behind him.  He watches for a moment and continues the aisle... Before he even reaches the rear of the club BELL RINGS and the next fight has already begun... Rocky fades into the darkness of the rear of the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky has nearly completed dressing and reaches into his locker for his hat... Also in the dingy room are ten othe fighters... Two taped fighters talk shop in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Tomorrow me an' my woman are gonna tip on down to Atlantic City, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's cold, Bro'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That's right, I got the city to myself... Another paces nervously... Two other fighters shadowbox a spit nervously on the floor. A young pug combs his hair and listens to a portable RADI that is BLASTING MUSIC. The fighter that Rocky has just defeated is drinking a be and joking with three other fighters... Some of the fight are smoking.  The room is cloudy. A short man of fifty enters.  He is dressed in a sweater buttoned over a t-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Balboa!? Rocky raises his head.  The promoter steps over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Twenty bucks for the locker an' cornerman -- Two bucks for the towel an' shower, seven for tax -- The house owes ya, sixty-one dollars. The man peels off the money and departs... Rocky closes h locker, nods to the defeated fighter, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky is on the trolley heading to South Philly... The trolley is empty except for a thin old black WOMAN... The black Woman studies Rocky's bruised face... Rocky becomes self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost apologetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tired)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yo' iz an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky exits the trolley and walks down the block... He wa at a pair of high-heeled hookers and they wave back. Rocky passes a sleeping wino curled in front of a dirty bookstore.  Rocky drags the man into a protective passage Further down the street, Rocky pauses in front of the "ANIMAL TOWN PET SHOP"... He peers into the dark store an sees a sad, huge dog sitting in the window.  He mumbles t the dog and continues to the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short while later, Rocky approaches his apartment locat in the most deprived section of South Philly.  He kicks a the litter that has gathered against the apartment steps enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The narrow hallway is painted olive brown.  A single ligh bulb illuminates the gloomy corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky enters.  The one-room apartment is drab, with a curling boxing poster of Rocky Marciano tacked on the wal Nailed against the far wall is a mattress.  The mattress used as a punching bag.  Stuffing spills out of the cente Rocky drops his coat on the floor.  He puts on a pair of glasses.  He crosses to a small turtle bowl... He lifts t creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Look who's home. Rocky starts to boil a pan of water on his hot plate, the places an old 45 RPM record on a battered phonograph.  Th record is a tune, "ALL IN THE GAME." ... As the CRACKLING MUSIC BEGINS, Rocky picks up his hairbrush.  Using it like a microphone, he mimes to the record.  He assumes the posture of a famous singer crooni to thousands of adoring fans... He then switches into a bullish fighting stance and throws several punches. The water boils.  Rocky soaks his badly-swollen hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE the jagged skyline, highlighted by the towering figure of William Penn that rises above the dawn haze as sits majestically above City Hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky is walking along the waterfront... He has a bandaid over one eye.  He looks at the rugged stevedores going ab their business... He stuffs his hands in his cheap wool jacket and approaches a ship being unloaded. Rocky passes two thick Mafia types leaning against a park car.  These men look like blood drinkers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Rock -- How's your Boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fightin' again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, here an' there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mebbe we make sum money togather soon... Give ya boss my best. Rocky shrugs and moves away... He nears a heavy man worki the crane.  The heavy man looks frightened... He stops th crane and hurries into the ship's hole.  Rocky dashes up gangplank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man enters the ship's hole and runs past tons of stac crates and coffee beans. Rocky sprints after him... He lunges and flings the man b the neck against the wall of stacked cargo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terror-filled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hit the face!  Not the face!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gazzo wants the two hundred now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honest to God I'm broke -- Gimme a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gazzo says I should get two hundred or break the thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I need my hands to work -- Christ, don't bust my thumbs. At wits' end the man picks up a large metal hook used by stevedores.  Rocky remains cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goin' fishin'? The man drops the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's ya name again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Bob, if ya wanna dance, ya gotta pay the band -- If ya borrow, ya gotta pay the man... Me, I ain't emotionally involved. Rocky's determined expression strikes home.  The fat man quickly fumbles through his pockets and hands over a smal wad of bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; counting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred an' thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, I'm broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? -- Completely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about for food an' stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have my food in ya hand. Rocky looks almost sympathetically into the fat man's flushed expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The juice is climbin' every week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the juice is climbin' -- I been workin' six months just to pay the damn interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya still light seventy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waits! -- Be smart.  Ya don't have to break nothin' -- Here, take my coat, it's worth fifty-sixty dollars.  It's yours. The man quickly removes his coat and extends it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, ya a smart guy, Gazzo's don't have to know nuthin'. I'll go tape up the hand like ya broke my thumb.  Gazzo won't be wise to nothin' -- Be a smart guy, keep the coat, we'll fake like ya broke the hand. The man extends his coat again... Rocky suddenly grabs th man's thumb and bends him to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - no - no - Please - Please - Please don't... Rocky releases the man who remains almost in shock.  The thumb is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That's what coulda happened. (walks off.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later that morning Rocky passes "Animal Town Pet Shop" in South Philly... The shop is not very prosperous looking. the window hangs a sign reading "Today's special -- Mixed Kittens -- $1.50"... Rocky stops at this shop every morni He stares at a litter of Lhasa Apsa puppies.  He taps the window and whistles.  He SEES a girl behind the counter a presses his face against the window and does his impressi of the Hunchback of Notre Dame.  The girl nervously looks away. The girl behind the counter is ADRIAN KLEIN.  She is not very attractive, but pleasant-looking.  Thirty years old. Brown hair pulled back.  Light skinned.  She wears glasse Rocky really stops by to flirt with Adrian, but she is so painfully shy nothing ever gets started... Rocky enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Could you take the puppy out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, nothin' - I paid for this dog and can do whatever I want with it - I can throw it through the window if I want - Now give me my two dollars back before I do throw it through the window. Rocky walks over to her, stares hard in her face and snat the bag out of her hand.  He removes the puppy and hands to Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me - Give me that! Rocky takes a couple dollars out of his pocket and hands to the lady... She nervously exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How's the turtle food this week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, I'm kinda aggravated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't your fault - Here's the problem. Adrian nods... Though charmed, she is slightly intimidate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last food I got here had more moths than flies -- An' the moths get caught in my turtle's throat -- That makes them cough -- The OWNER, a squat woman of forty, steps out of the back waves at Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Gloria -- I was talkin' about the turtle food -- Like I was sayin', the moths get caught in the turtle's throat an' makes 'em cough... (coughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little cough an' I gotta smack 'em on the shell -- An' whatta think they get? Adrian shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smack 'em hard on the shell an' they get... What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shell-shocked! Both the Owner and Adrian smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startin' with the bad jokes early today, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inventin' jokes ain't easy. Rocky steps over to a large cage at the rear of the shop. Inside is a huge dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Butkus this mornin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't had time to check 'em. Rocky opens the cage and the large dog jumps out and look very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Butkus -- Dead.  Play dead. The dog plays dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What kinda dog is this again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullmastiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The owner was suppose to pick him up three weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not responsible for animals left over thirty days - We board it ain't a animal shelter, Y'know. ...Adrian, I want you to clean all those cat cages downstairs, they're a mess. (Adrian nods.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky waves goodbye to Adrian and exits the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gazzo picks up Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: MR. GAZZO and his YOUNG BODY GUARD sit in the front seat. Rocky is in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He only had a hundred an' thirty. -- I think he's good for the rest next week, Mr. Gazzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patiently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Rocky, Bob's good for it... Gazzo hands Rocky a twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow collect from Del Rio -- He's late three weeks. How'd you do last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Fine. Gazzo's Bodyguard looks at Rocky's bruised face in the mirror and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did ya get the license number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of wa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Of the truck that run over your face. Gazzo steps out of the car and beckons to Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Rock.  Did I give you a job this mornin?  How come ya didn't break this guy's thumb like I asked ya?  When ya don't do what ya are told, it makes me look bad, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure if I break the thumb this guy gets thrown outta his job and can't pay nothin no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It don't matter.  It's my reputation.  These guys think they can get off light.  It's bad for my reputation -- It's bad for business.  See ya killer. Gazzo gets into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bodyguard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The Rock's a good kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotionless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A meatbag. They pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gazzo drives off and Rocky strolls across the street to Goldmill's Gym.  On the way he passes several familiar people and exchanges waves... Out front is a young Irishm who runs a soft pretzel stand... His name is RUDY.  It is apparent from his face he was a prize fighter... He is bl and mentally defective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...See the fight last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I was fightin' myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo Creed beat the bum to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey's Gym is surrounded by bars and a couple of greasy spoons.  Out front a crowd of young Blacks talk and jive among themselves.  Two winos lean against the entrance. Rocky enters the gym... The place is nearly full.  The MEASURED BEAT of SKIP ROPES and THROBBING SPEED BAGS make the room come alive, like it was a mindless piece of machinery.  Over the loudspeaker MUSIC by the Isley Broth BLARES out... The music adds a background to the CLANG of the AUTOMATIC TIMERS, SNORTING SPARRING PARTNERS and the THUDDING of HEAVY BAGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is divided -- Fifty percent Black -- thirty-five percent Latin -- ten percent white -- five percent other. As Rocky walks through the gym many of the FIGHTERS pause wave and yell greetings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hear ya knocked Spider Rice out in the sixth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third -- Shoulda seen it. Rocky passes another FIGHTER punching the heavy bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (removes glove)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rock, touch my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, it's important. Rocky touches the Fighter's bare hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can ya tell I just whacked-off? Rocky smiles and moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dressing room is lined with dented lockers.  Wooden benches stretch across the room.  On the wall is a sign t reads, "NO KISSING." Rocky goes to his locker.  He tries to open it but fails. He leans his ear against the lock and rolls the tumblers. Still it does not open.  He shakes the lock forcefully, n luck... Rocky is flustered and sits on a bench to ponder situation. After a moment of deep thought, Rocky stands, seizes the bench and smashes open the lock.  Opening the door Rocky taken aback when he sees a set of very flashy clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... These ain't my clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a picture of several black girls taped on the ins of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... These ain't my pictures. A short powerful man of thirty-five enters.  His hair loo like it has been shaped with hedge clippers.  His name is MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Mike -- What's happenin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't your locker no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta ya talkin' about it ain't my locker no more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm with you -- But ya gotta talk to Mickey -- I put ya stuff in the bag over there. Rocky looks at his belongings crammed in a wilted shoppin bag and follows Mike across the room... Mike leans his he into the shower room.  Two Latin fighters are lathering u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Hey, Peanut, gimme some soap, Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nobody -- Yeah, you, Nobody -- You don't call me Peanut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peanut, gimme some soap. The fighters laugh.  Inflamed, Mike removes a bar of soap from his pocket and hurls it at the insulting fighter.  I hits just above the man's head.  The fighters are shocked into silence. Mike turns and exits with Rocky... The fighters curse the loudly in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky and Mike move past fighters going through their training routines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were ready to bite that guy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- See the fight last night?  Apollo Creed beat that English guy bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creed's great. Mike fakes a friendly punch at Rocky and hurries off to another chore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owner, MICKEY, sits on a stool near the entrance.  He wears a baggy suit... He is in his late seventies. Rocky approaches... Mickey is conversing with another fig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what nobody says, this bum Creed woulda never made it in the Thirties --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how ya feelin', Mickey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (monotoned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, how ya feelin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see me talkin'?  Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spitting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then stand there an' wait till I'm done -- Creed's good, yeah, he's real fine but I gotta boy, y'know Big Dipper, who's got the stuff it takes to be a champ -- He's mean, quick, an' big -- What more d'ya need?  Okay, go to work... (to Rocky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- Yeah -- Whatta ya want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was talkin' with ya man, Mike. -- Hey, how come I been put outta my locker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dipper needed it. Rocky turns and looks at DIPPER sparring... Dipper is a young, muscular heavyweight with a mean expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dipper's a climber -- You're a tomato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Tomato?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facts is facts.  I run a business here -- I'm cleanin' house -- Mickey pauses to watch a young middleweight time-skip as trainer sings "FASCINATIN' RHYTHM."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come July, twenty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five, thirty -- What's the difference? -- It took me two months to learn the combination of that locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The legs must be goin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they're goin', -- that's nature... That was my locker for six years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Did ya fight last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did ya win?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Kayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Who'd ya fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spider Rice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice is a bum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think everybody I fight is a bum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't they? Mickey shoots Rocky a quick, indifferent look and removes rosary from his pocket and idly rolls it around his finge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya want the truth -- Ya got heart, but ya fight like an ape -- The only thing special about you is ya never got ya nose broke -- keep ya nose pretty -- what's left of ya brain an' retire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm gonna take a steam -- Did good last night -- Shoulda seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, ever think about retirin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Shrugging, Rocky moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I think I'm gonna take a steam -- Shoulda seen me fight -- Did good, y'know. Mickey leans over to Mike who approaches with a mop and p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing towards Rocky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Known him since he was fifteen -- A waste of life. Dejected, Rocky travels to the locker room.  He passes Bi Dipper sparring in a ring... Dipper spits a mouthful of water in a bucket and looks smugly at Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rocky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I dig yo' locker, Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time, Dipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dipper smiles cruelly and begins sparring... Scene FADES Rocky's crestfallen expression.  He moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At sunset Rocky comes down the street and pauses at the p shop... He is eating Colonel Sanders' fried chicken out o bag... He taps on the window with a chicken bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside Adrian is arranging pet toys on the counter... She hears the tapping, sees Rocky, and tenses.  Rocky enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Wow -- cold!  Good night to catch pneumonia. Adrian smiles slightly and moves behind the counter.  Roc fumbles idly among the pet toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah -- I came in here for somethin'... Oh, yeah, would ya like somebody to walk ya home? The girl wants to say yes but a tremendous inferiority complex will not permit it... Rocky understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how's my buddy doin'? (looks into Butkus' cage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Nice dog -- Well, I'll see ya later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Goodnight, Rocky. Rocky exits.  Adrian watches his departure with mixed emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short while later Rocky arrives at Andy's Bar... He thr the Colonel Sanders bag and bones in a large public litte can.  The trash can has a bicentennial picture of George Washington pointing at a pile of garbage.  The caption reads, "There was no litter at Valley Forge!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky enters the bar.  He sits the Drunk in a booth... Several drinkers wave at him.  OLD ANDY sets a mug of bee in front of him... Rocky seems to be looking for someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch pneumonia out there -- Seen Paulie? Andy casually nods towards the men's room. Rocky traverses the room and passes TWO DRUNKS leaning on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky enters the restroom... It is a vile stench hole wit years of the remnants of many sick drunks caked on the wa PAULIE is presently trying to comb his hair in the only remaining piece of mirror in the room... Paulie is in his early thirties.  He is medium height.  Brown hair.  Squar shouldered.  He has a foul personality... A classic misanthrope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Paulie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very drunk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Rocky -- Look at this mirror.  I'd like to kill the friggin' moron who broke this mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Paulie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your sister's givin' me the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget her.  You could do better than my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every mornin', every night I pass by -- I smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say jokes.  Nothin'.  She looks at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like I was a plate of leftovers -- Somethin' wrong with my face -- Whatta I need, a Caddy to connect with ya sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister's a friggin' loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes she gets me so crazy, I'd like to split her head with a razor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get mental, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya caught me in a bad mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya always in a bad mood --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Adrian ain't sharp. The restroom stench is overwhelming... Rocky covers his n with the neckline of his t-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a loser -- She don't enjoy life -- She reads -- Brainy -- Pushin' thirty friggin' years old!  She's gonna die alone if she don't wise up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thirty myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An' you're dyin' alone, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see no crowd around you, neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at the wall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna kill the friggin' moron who broke the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get outta this stink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restroom door opens.  Rocky guides Paulie out.  Thoug stumbling, Paulie talks as he walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl's dryin' up!  She's gotta live a little before her body dries up!!  You're a pal, Rock -- How 'bout yo' talk to her?  Y'know, it's Thanksgivin' tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow you come for some bird, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely... Paulie smiles and Rocky guides him to a booth... Rocky st to the bar.  Andy leans over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was alotta crap to go through for a dinner invite. Rocky shakes his head no and raises his eyes towards a suspended television... the nightly sports broadcast is o The SPORTS COMMENTATOR is at the airport and about to interview the heavyweight champion of the world, APOLLO CREED.  Creed is twenty-eight years old.  He is a tall, smooth-muscled Black with barely a scar on his light coff colored face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is followed by an entourage of mixed trainers and cornermen.  Also tagging alone is a small group of hanger The Commentator interviews Creed as he and his followers disembark a private jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was the flight, Champ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very high an' very fast. Apollo's crowd smiles almost automatically at everything says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo, how would you rate this last British challenger, Henry Wilcoxson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was big, an' very nasty so I destroyed him in a hurry -- Now I'm gettin' ready for Mac Lee Green next month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're referring to the much publicized bicentennial fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- It's gonna be the greatest sportin' event in this country's history -- A gala occurrence!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still to be held in Philadelphia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bicentennial Heavyweight Championship of the World is gonna be held in the only place it can be held -- Philadelphia! -- the nation's cradle -- January First -- the first major event of our two hundredth year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're you off to now? Apollo draws his wife close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me an' my wife are goin' home 'cause we miss our children an' can't go no more time without seein' them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any quick advice for young boxing hopefuls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks straight into the camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Stay in school an' use your brains, dig -- Be a lawyer, be a doctor, carry a leather briefcase an' forget about sports!!  Sports can only make ya grunt an' smell -- Be a thinker not a stinker!! Apollo's entourage laughs and they move on... The Comment faces the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry Simpson at Kennedy Airport with the Champion, Apollo Creed. The sports show cuts away, but Rocky continues to look at the television with a pensive stare... Andy has been spea the following dialogue over Apollo's broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody cares what's happenin' in the world of sports nomore -- Downhill.  Baseball, downhill -- Basketball, downhill.  Football's goin', too.  Bank on it.  Baseball use to be America's best sport... Sure -- Nuttin' like squattin' through a great double header, but now baseball's all business. The news report with Apollo ends.  Andy drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the real fighters? The pros.  Today we jig clowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took his best shot an' became champ -- What shot did you ever take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Rock, you ain't happy with yourself?  Fine.  But me, I gotta business here -- I don't need to take no shot. Becoming despondent, Rocky rises and crosses to Paulie slumped unconscious in the booth. Rocky exits the bar... Andy turns to his customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; boldly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a shot, he says! -- Sure, I'll take a shot! Laughing, Andy pours himself a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky passes an all-night sandwich shop... In the window hangs the sign "ATOMIC HOAGIE SHOP, INC." Out front are several YOUNG MEN and WOMEN.  They are much too young to out so late... A boy with a badly-chipped tooth beckons t Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aggressively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Rocks, buy us sum wine, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No wine -- Bad for ya' brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, man, it's cold, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Rock, gimme a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause we dig ya, man -- Gimme a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, give Rocky a dime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he can call all his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mildly embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That's an old one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy us some Thunderbird, man. Rocky ignores the statement and faces a very young girl w is smoking and leaning whore-like against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Marie? -- Marie, ya brother know you're hangin' out so late? The girl, MARIE, assumes an indifferent attitude, attempt to impress her friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Screw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Screw you, yoyo. The gang laughs.  Angered and shocked, Rocky grabs her ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did these guys teach you to talk dirty?  Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff it, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you never say that -- (to the gang)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You guys talk like that in front of a little girl -- You guys are scum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our place, dig! The gang reluctantly backs up a step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ya never come round this girl -- Go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our corner, man!  You go, chump! Rocky moves forward and they scatter... They quickly move

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backpedaling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll kill you, man -- We gotta gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull heat on me? -- I'll dent ya face! Rocky leads the girl away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky is walking the young girl home... They are presentl cutting through a dark public school yard.  They pass through the beams of light cast off by weak flood lights located at the top of the school building.  The atmospher is somewhat eerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come ya wanna hang out with those guys?  They teach ya bad things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like 'em.  If you don't you can f--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  When I was your age, there was only one girl who talked like that in the whole neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bored)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah. She attempts to light a cigarette... Rocky nonchalantly tosses it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make your teeth yella --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like yella teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes your breath like garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I like garbage. Rocky and Marie take a shortcut through a dark school yar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody likes garbage -- Anyway, this girl with the dirty mouth wasn't bad lookin', but the guys wouldn't take her out for any serious datin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause that's the way guys are -- They laugh when ya talk dirty.  They think ya cute for a while, but then ya getta reputation an' watch out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's ever gonna take ya serious.  Ya get no respect... I gotta use a bad word -- Whore.  You'll end up maybe becomin' a whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Rocky.  I'm twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter -- You don't really have to be a whore, just act like one an' that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, a bad reputation -- Twenty years from now people will say 'D'you remember Marie?' 'No, who was she?' 'She was that little whore who hung out at the Atomic Hoagie Shop.' 'Oh, now I remember!'... See, they don't remember you, they remember the rep. Rocky and Marie exit the dark school yard... Standing in shadows of the building are three young muggers.  The lig from their cigarettes flares red in their faces. The muggers pace Rocky across the street and follow them down the block... Rocky sees them and stops and faces the three.  The muggers pause and study Rocky from a distance twenty yards.  Rocky gives a loud boxer's snort, wipes hi nose with the side of his thumb and rolls his shoulders.. The muggers are intimidated and slowly peel off the meand away. Rocky turns to Marie who has been standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points down the block)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That's your house, ain't it? Marie nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I hope ya don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was I gonna say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya hope I don't keep acting like a whore or I'll turn into one, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya, somethin' like that. They exchange smiles and Marie moves away.  Rocky has mad an impact on her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Night, Marie. She takes a few more steps and pauses again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Fuck you, Creepo!!! The girl runs to her house as Rocky looks on in dismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walks off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah, who're you to give advice, Creepo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APOLLO CREED and his LAWYER and TRAINER are seated in the offices of MILES JERGENS.  Jergens, a successful promoter looks unhappy as he looks into the scowling face of Apoll Creed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the doctor's reports confirmed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely -- (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It says here, Mac Lee Green has suffered a seriously cracked third metacarpal in his left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose we could cancel the fight indefinitely if you are set on fighting Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't just Green, what about the time Apollo's invested --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we can find a solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solution, nothin' -- What about the Bicentennial fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jergens, don't play games with my client!  Apollo has already done nearly a million dollars worth of publicity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten million's worth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And has made contractual obligations with over twenty different organizations -- He doesn't want to be embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You best find me another ranked contender an' I mean in a flash, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up some notes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I contacted Ernie Roman's manager, he's fighting in France the same week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then gimme Buddy Shaw -- He's ranked fifth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw's fighting in South America -- Why not postpone the bout until July Fourth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell with Fourth of July, man! Ten thousand things'll be goin' down on the Fourth of July! -- Apollo wants to be first!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may not be possible, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man here is the Star, dig -- Don't cause him to breathe heavy -- Now what 'bout that sucker, Billy Dukes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Went to California and gained fifty pounds -- and I called every worthwhile contender, but they say five weeks isn't enough time to get in shape. Apollo stands beneath a new fight poster and points to it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shape, nothin' -- They're afraid.  They know everybody in the world's gonna see this fight an' none of them gotta prayer of beating me so they're makin' excuses so they don't have to be the chump that's gonna be whipped in front of the whole civilized world!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo, I'm sure there's a way to salvage this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody wants to be dissected on the country's birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can counter with is that I'm a goddamn good promoter -- I've promoted in every country in the world -- and I've tried to the best of my abilities. Perhaps you're right, and no one wants to be beat on the country's birthday... I don't know what else to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do -- Maybe what this fight needs is something new -- a novelty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You's the novelty, Champ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give my main man a raise!! Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now here's what's goin' down. Listen, 'cause I'm gonna say this but one time.  On January first, the first day of the Bicentennial I'm gonna fight me a local poor underdog, dig? A snow-white underdog.  An' I'm gonna put his face on this poster with me, hear?  An' I'll tell you why, 'cause I'm sentimental -- An' all the people in the country all sentimental, man, an' they'd like nothin' better than me, Apollo Creed, to let some unknown get a shot at the greatest title in the world on this country's biggest birthday. Now that's the way I see it an' that's the way I want it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's very American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man, it's very smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late that afternoon Mr. Gazzo's white 1970 Cadillac pulls to Rocky's apartment... Rocky is in the back seat with th loan shark.  Gazzo's bodyguard is driving. Gazzo flips through a small black notepad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next Wednesday I grab a grand from Snyder.  An' Thursday two yards from Cappoli, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, two yards from Snyder, an' a grand from Cappoli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, screw ya brain on right. Now, who's this girl you're going out with tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I don't hear things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie's sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abrasively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear she's retarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ain't retarded, she's shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take 'er to the zoo -- Retards like the zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that bum have to say that? The Bodyguard reddens... Gazzo motions to his Bodyguard t relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy's in a bad mood -- prostate problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's always in a bad mood. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count ya blessin's.  Ya a healthy person -- ya legs work -- ya hands work -- The Bodyguard has been looking at Rocky with murderous ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like ya face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't like yours neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move your shoulders down. Mr. Gazzo is amused.  He steps out of the car, followed b Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy's got a thing against ya, Rock.  Some people just hate for no reason, y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's fifty bucks -- You an' the girl have a nice time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mr. Gazzo. Rocky enters his apartment and Gazzo drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCENE REVERTS BACK TO Miles Jergens' office.  Apollo pores over a large record book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout this Billy Snow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fouls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout this Big Chuck Smith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too old, dull fighter. (points at a name)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Judge is a good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't feel heat from the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Zack is a good prospect -- Exciting boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Still don't feel no heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly what are you looking for, Apollo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... This man. Everybody leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; much amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The Italian Stallion' -- He's my man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky Balboa -- His record's poor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't matter -- That name. 'The Italian Stallion,' it's right on. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who discovered America?  An Italian, right?  So, man, what could be better than to get it on with one of his ancestors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't last one round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I gonna carry this boy three rounds, then drop 'im like a bad habit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like you messin' with southpaws -- They do everything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Southpaw, nuthin' -- I'll drop 'im in three -- 'Apollo Creed meets the Italian Stallion.' Shhiii -- Sounds like a damn monster movie!! Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky and Paulie walk towards his house... Even though it cold and dark, a group of kids conduct an energetic game half-ball. (Half-ball is a variation of stick-ball.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimes throwing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I usta be deadly at half-ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate the friggin' game... I'd like to talk some business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at my hands -- See how the joints are swollen. Paulie extends his thick hands and tries to make a fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inflamed joints -- Walkin' in an' out of a freezer carryin' meat plays hell on the joints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe ya should see a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a doctor, I need a different job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe another job is the best thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor -- Talk to Gazzo. Tell him I'm a friend an' would do a good job... Tell him I ain't bothered by nothin' an' would be a great collector... Bustin' bones don't bother me -- Tell him I'm a good worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gazzo's gotta come to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm askin' ya to go to him -- As a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gazzo's gotta come to you -- Hey, Paulie, it's a bad job -- Do what you do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue past the Atomic Hoagie Shoppe, Inc... A gro of young men pitch quarters on the sidewalk out front. Rocky pauses... He sees Marie, the little girl from the night before, hanging around with the guys.  She sees Roc Marie takes a deep drag on her cigarette and faces the opposite direction... The gang smiles and continues to pi quarters. Anger and disappointment register across Rocky's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know her? Rocky shrugs and the two men move off... Filling the nigh air is the METALLIC SOUND of pitching QUARTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men arrive at Paulie's home.  It is at the top of a dimly-lit four story walk-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya sister knows I'm comin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure -- She's very excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie unlocks the apartment door and enters... Rocky stiffly follows.  Paulie's sister steps out of the kitche A large serving spoon is in her hand... The TV is on. She stops short and eyes Rocky... She is visibly unsettle by Rocky's unexpected presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie, you're late. She looks at Rocky again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call the hospital? (to Rocky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm ten minutes late, she calls the hospital. Adrian enters the bedroom and slams the door... Paulie follows.  An argument ensues and Rocky overhears. OVER the argument is HEARD a SPORTS BROADCAST rising from the TELEVISION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Unfortunate luck for fifth-ranked heavyweight, Mac Lee Green.  The slugging fighter acquired a serious fracture in his left hand after an aggressive day of sparring -- Champion Apollo Creed says he'll be 'shopping for another victim,' to fill Green's vacancy for the Bicentennial Championship Fight to be held in Philly next month... By the way, rumor has it that this will be the most widely-viewed sporting event in the entire world -- and that includes the Super Bowl, folks... Today U.S. swimmers set a new...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the argument between brother and sister contin in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Paulie, why didn't you tell me you were bringing him home?!  Look at me, I'm not ready for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it would make a difference if you were, right?  This guy's a friend and now he's takin' ya out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya, ya goin' outta the bedroom an' I don't wanna know from nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie, please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I want ya out instamaticly. -- I'm sicka lookin' at ya hangin' around like a friggin' spider -- Go out -- Live!  Do, enjoy life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get wise with me.  I want ya to stop bein' a loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie, it's Thanksgiving. I've gotta turkey in the oven. Paulie turns and leaves the bedroom... He enters the kitc Grabbing a large fork, he opens the oven and spears the turkey... With the turkey suspended on the end of the for Paulie heaves the dripping bird out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian has seen this and is shattered.  She runs back int the bedroom and locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: !! Ya want the bird, go out in the alley an' eat the bird -- I want ya outta the house -- Enjoy ya friggin' life... Ya hungry, Rock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe ya better forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget nothin' -- Here, talk to my sister, tell 'er somethin' nice. Rocky walks over to Adrian's bedroom door and begins spea to the enclosed girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yo, Adrian, it's me, Rocky... Ah, ah -- Ah, it's kinda hard for me to think of somethin' to say, y'know -- 'Cause I never talked to a door before, I mean whatta ya say to a door. Rocky turns away and begins to walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Maybe I better forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try again, c'mon, try again. Rocky goes over to the door and begins speaking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Adrian, I know ya ain't too happy at this moment, but would ya do me a favor -- I ain't got nobody to spend Thanksgivin' with -- How 'bout you an' me goin' out -- Get somethin' to eat, maybe laugh a little, who knows... Would ya like, I dunno, go out together? Adrian opens the door... She already has her winter coat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have a good time. Paulie opens the front door and gives Rocky an encouragin smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's ya sister like to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice skate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want no turkey anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Thanksgiving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you, to me it's Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky and Adrian enter a deserted skating rink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks quiet, y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think mebbe we're early or somethin' -- From across the rink a CLEANING MAN yells at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, whatta ya doin' here -- we're closed... Yo, we're closed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are ya closed to the General Public or to just everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts to walk over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the rink is empty 'cause we're closed -- ya ain't allowed in here so do me a favor an' not stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here, gotta smooth this guy out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could go somewhere else an' -- Rocky approaches the Cleaner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, pal, what's with you -- The place ain't operatin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I gotta problem.  This girl ain't feelin' well, y'know -- The doctor says she should exercise, y'know once in awhile an' ice skatin' is the best thing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This a con?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her, ya can see she ain't feelin' good -- needs a few minutes exercise --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes for ten dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah, give 'er the Blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian has on skates.  Rocky follows her onto the ice.  H wears street shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Aren't you skating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't skated since I was fifteen -- That's when I started fightin' -- gotta watch the ankles.  Yeah, fightin' use to be tops with me, but no more.  All I wanted to prove was I weren't no bum -- That I had the stuff to make a good pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you never got the chance? The Cleaner yells from the sideline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I ain't cryin'... I still fight.  Kinda do it like a hobby.  See I'm a natural southpaw an' most pugs won't fight a southpaw 'cause we mess up their timin' an' look awkward -- Southpaw means lefthanded... But I guess in the long run things probably worked out for the best, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you never had a chance to prove yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight minutes! Adrian slips and Rocky breaks her fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just dislocated my finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't your fault -- I originally done it in the Baby Crenshaw fight. (opens his wallet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me fightin' Big Baby Crenshaw -- Big Baby was the size of an airplane an' I broke my hands on his head -- I lost, but it's a nice picture, don't ya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout some Cokes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cost ya a buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy is beautiful -- get the Cokes. Adrian does a slight turn and Rocky has to speed up and nearly falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I ain't graceful, y'know -- I don't move good -- Stink as a dancer too -- But I can really swat, I hit hard,                real hard, bu an' nobody wants to fight a southpaw! -- Havin' a good time? Adrian nods and is very nervous... The Cleaner moves carefully across the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know how I got started in the fight racket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By accident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here -- Three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- My ol' man who was never the sharpest told me -- I weren't born with much brain so I better use my body. For the first time, Adrian laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother told me just the opposite.  She said, 'You weren't born with much of a body so you'd better develop your brain.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time! The Cleaner walks over as Rocky and Adrian get off the ic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ten bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must be goin' deaf 'cause I thought ya said, 'ten cents.' Rocky hands him a dime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How 'bout for the Cokes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charge it. Rocky and Adrian start to leave.  Rocky pauses at the doo and fishes into his pocket and hands over eleven dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had ya goin', didn't I, huh? He grins and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people are very shy by nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would say you're very shy bu nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people think bein' shy is a disease, but it don't bother me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't bother me either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did I bother bringin' it up?  'Cause I'm dumb, that's why... Y'know, I think we make a real sharp coupla coconuts -- I'm dumb an' you're shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It is just hard for me to understand why anybody wants to be a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya gotta be a little soft to wanna be a pug... It's a racket where ya' almost guaranteed to end up a bum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're a bum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm at least half a bum. Yeah, fightin' is a crazy racket.  The roughest part is the mornin' after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a rough fight, ya' nothin' but a large wound. Sometimes I feel like callin' a taxi to drive me from my bed to the bathroom... Ya' eyes hurt, ya' ears hurt, ya' hair even hurts... But the thing I'm proud of is I been in over sixty fights an' never had a busted nose -- Bent an' twisted an' bitten but never broke... That's rare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do it if it hurts so bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you can't sing or dance? Rocky smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky and Adrian enter his one-room apartment... She is nervous and taken aback by the bleakness of the room... Rocky goes to the icebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would ya like a glass of water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No thanks. Adrian looks at the mirror above Rocky's dresser.  She se a high school photo of Rocky.  He once was handsome and smooth-faced... Rocky steps up behind her and his face is reflected in the mirror. He turns on his cheap RECORD PLAYER... He reaches into th turtle bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the guys I was tellin' ya about -- This is Cuff an' Link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sold them to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Oh, yeah, I bought the whole kit -- Yeah, ya sold me the turtles, the bowl, an' the mountain -- I had to get rid of the mountain 'cause they kept fallin' off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had it pulled.  People callin' all the time.  Who needs it -- Who'd you wanna call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna let my brother know where I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'you really wanna call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he might be worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call your brother. Rocky flings open the window and bellows like a foghorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: !!Yo, Paulie -- Ya sister's with me!  I'll call ya later. Rocky closes the window and faces the woman... She is not smiling.  She looks frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?  Ya don't like the room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only temporary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?  You don't like me -- Don't like the turtles -- What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I belong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't belong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right -- You're my guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I've never been in a man's apartment before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I know you well enough -- I don't think I'm comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, I'm not comfortable either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm willin' to make the best of this uncomfortable situation. Adrian moves to the door... Rocky intercepts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would ya take off your glasses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbstruck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glasses... Please. Rocky removes her glasses and looks deeply into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (timidly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... T-thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me another favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could ya take off that hat. After a moment, Adrian removes the hat... She is becoming rather pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew you was pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tease me. The woman melts into the corner and begins lightly sobbin Rocky steps forward and fences her with his arms and body

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna kiss ya -- Ya don't have to kiss me back if ya don't feel like it. Rocky softly kisses the woman... Her arms hang limp.  He puts more passion into the kiss and she starts to respond Her hand glides like smoke up his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She embraces his neck.  The dam of passion erupts.  She gives herself freely for the first time in thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following day, Rocky strolls down the street to Goldmill's Gym... Out front a group of young blacks stop talking and study Rocky as he passes.  Rocky's eyebrows k in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky climbs the stairs and enters the gym... ... In a matter of seconds, his presence is known and the athletes stare in wonderment... The big black heavyweight contender, Dipper, throws down his towel in disgust and turns away. Mike quietly approaches Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rock -- What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout what? Mickey Goldmill steps out of his office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did ya get the message, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Message -- What message? Mickey pulls out a card from his breast pocket... He hand it to Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Rep from Miles Jergens' Promotions was lookin' for ya -- They need sparrin' partners for Creed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya puttin' me on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the card?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was they here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably lookin' for sparrin' partners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I said that before. Rocky turns from Mickey and jogs out of the gym.  Mickey fumbles with his rosary beads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Waste of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky steps off a bus in mid-town Philadelphia.  He hurri down Broad Street.  Every few steps he breaks into a trot He enters a skyscraper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky exits the elevator and enters the office of Miles Jergens' Productions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECRETARY is slightly startled by Rocky's excited expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you? Rocky hands her the business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balboa, Rocky Balboa. The Secretary rises and enters Jergens' office... Rocky e the multitude of sporting pictures hanging on all four wa The Secretary returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may go in. Rocky collects himself and enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles Jergens warmly greets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Balboa -- I'm Miles Jergens -- Please, have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Balboa --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overriding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, do you have any representation?  A manager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- Just me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, would you be interested in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparrin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know ya need sparrin' partners -- I'm very available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely -- Sparrin' with the Champ would be an honor -- y'know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't take no cheap shots. I'd be a good sparrin' partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jergens seems very amused.  He lights a cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, would you be interested in fighting Apollo Creed for the Championship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Like I said, I'd make a boss sparrin' mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, an' I'm smart enough to know that no sparrin' partner should take cheap shots at the Champ.  He's just there to help condition the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not spar, I'm asking whether you would be interested in fighting Creed for the championship. The weight of the statement comes crashing down in Rocky. For a long moment he becomes nothing more than a basket c as he ponders the statement... He half regains his senses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ah... Absolutely. The SCENE FADES and becomes a black and white television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky and Adrian are at her home watching an old black an white television... Rocky smiles... The film now cuts to Apollo being interviewed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you like the 'City of Brotherly Love?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like my Philadelphia Brothers. An' I'm patriotic! Apollo has to move to the side to avoid a thrusting microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; mock seriousness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If yo' don't back up I'm gonna send yo' home with a microphone in yo' nose! The Reporters laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you agree to fight a man who has virtually no chance of winning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If history proves one thing, everybody gotta chance -- Didn't yo' all ever hear of David an' Goliath? -- 'Course I woulda knocked out Goliath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a coincidence that you're fighting a white man on the most celebrated day in the country's history?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same coincidence that he's fightin' a black man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're your feelings about the challenger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's Italian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means if he can't fight, I bet he can cook! Rocky and Adrian laugh at the interview... Paulie, her brother, takes offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor -- His lungs, punch 'em out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky's interview now fills the screen.  Rocky squints an looks nervous under the hot lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your largest payday ever -- How do you feel about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel?  I dunno... Happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you fight Apollo Creed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mind elsewhere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creed's great, ain't he... I'll do what I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get the name, 'Italian Stallion?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought of it 'bout eight years ago, when I was eatin' dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true the most you've ever made in a prizefight is five hundred dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred -- But that was a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now your payday will be one hundred and fifty thousand dollars.  Any comment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I wanna say hi to my girlfriend -- Yo, Adrian! Adrian blushes and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Rocky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
