dialogues.text: Sure I did.  You heard. They continue to watch the remainder of the interview... head COMMENTATOR is looking directly into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Bicentennial Fight -- January first.  It will be the first sporting event on our two hundredth birthday and is already being called by many the greatest farce in sports history.  If this man lasts more than a minute I would say he's on borrowed time. (sarcastically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's matches like this with their exorbitant prices that give sports a bad name -- Not only is this match bad, people, it's sad!  Why a Rocky Balboa?  At the State Athletic Commission, Larry Duggan reporting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's a friggin' moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't it matter none he's makin' ya out a fool? -- I'd break his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It don't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's takin' cheap shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It don't bother me none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Rock -- now ya'll be lookin' for people to help, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, to help keep ya livin' clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya gotta have a guy help ya exercise, mebbe somebody to be standin' by with a towel or run errands, y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, who cared about me yesterday, huh?  Nobody -- I think I'm gonna train myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without havin' good people around, ya won't have such a good chance. Adrian is not happy with her brother's overbearing attitu She faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein flunked out of school... twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roosevelt finished last in his class -- Beethoven was deaf, an' Helen Keller was blind -- I think Rocky has a good chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky stands in Adrian's doorway.  He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya tomorrow. Rocky moves down the stairway and continues to do so as h converses with Adrian who remains upstairs.  His VOICE ECHOES up the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd ya like hearin' ya name on TV?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- I was shocked. Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya puttin' me on, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely -- What time should I expect you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting. Rocky is now on the ground floor yelling up to Adrian on top floor landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know how I said that stuff on television didn't bother me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It did. As Rocky completes the last word, he exits the building a slams the door which RESOUNDS throughout the apartment ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gazzo, the bodyguard, and Rocky are standing out front. They are eating hot sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know I won't be able to work for ya no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- if a good man can make a better life, let him make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel bad about walkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your shot, kid -- You got money for trainin' expenses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few bucks. Gazzo takes out a wad and peels off several bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's five hundred -- Put it in your glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to pay juice? Gazzo looks at the Bodyguard and shakes his head as if to imply, "Why's this guy asking such a foolish question?" Gazzo and the bodyguard step to the white Caddy parked at the curb.  They enter the cab.  Rocky watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Santa Claus charge juice? Merry Christmas -- Now, how's about my present, ya gonna win?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, kid, I'm with ya.  Ya know, I'm with ya -- Italian, we're blood.  You kill this rug -- We Guinneas gotta show these Afro-Americans where it's at.  Give it your best shot cause I want ya to prove to these bums on the corner that my man can't be beat by this rug... Ya got any action on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya gettin 150 grand killer. Ya got any plans for it? Whatta ya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya like to put it on the street, make it work for ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna do somethin with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, you do what ya want. Stay away from the stock market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black market?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing.  Ya know, Rock, remember when we was kids, we fought together.  An' I wasn't well an' ya had to beat up that Irish kid -- what's his name? -- Gallager -- I bought a suit and became a businessman. You put on gloves.  An' I remember Mama almost cried, may she rest in peace -- an' our ol' man who said ya had no brains -- I'd like to lay hands on that bastard.  You ain't never had any luck. Even when I owned you in '66 you never had luck.  But now I think you might be gettin' some luck kid.  Whatta you think? Rocky smiles and Gazzo gets into his car.  Rocky follows across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, you gonna show, Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where else am I gonna go. (to Bodyguard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet three grand on Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a bum -- are you kiddin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps Bodyguard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I'm not kiddin! Rocky walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky returns home and enters his apartment.  After turni on the light, he flips on his RECORD PLAYER.  He now feed the turtles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's home! Rocky notices two telegrams laying inside the threshold. approaches them with a sense of awe.  He opens and reads Settling on the bed, he reads the other. A KNOCK is HEARD.  Rocky opens the door.  Mickey Goldmill the gym owner, stands framed in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stiffly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen the light.  I figure somebody was home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mickey -- Whatta ya doin' here?  Here, sit down. Rocky tosses soiled clothing off a mangled armchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best seat in the house -- Hey, Mick, this is too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm usta seein' ya at the gym, but seein' ya here, in my house, it's kinda outta joint. By the manner in which Goldmill listens, it is obvious something important is preying on his mind. Rocky is slightly uncomfortable, almost embarrassed at having outsiders see how he lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Rock, you're a very lucky guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened is freak luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freak luck for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at all them other fighters. Real good boys.  Good records. Colorful.  Fight their hearts out for peanuts -- But who cared?  Nobody.  They got it shoved in their back door. Nobody ever give them a shot at the title...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freak luck is a strange thing. Mickey does not hear.  His attention is drawn to the turt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta' those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turtles -- domestic turtles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (businesslike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here tellin' ya to be very smart with this shot.  Like the Bible sez, ya don't get no second chance. Mickey looks hard into Rocky's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya need a manager.  An advisor. I been in the racket fifty years.  I done it all, there ain't nothin' about the world of pugilism that ain't livin' up here. He lights a half-smoked cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at a loss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty years, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stronger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty years.  The rep is known around Philly, an' a good rep can't be bought, but I don't have to tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout a glass of water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, d'ya know what I done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (driving each word hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I done it all.  I've done an' seen everything'.  Believe what I'm tellin' ya -- Ya shoulda seen the night in Brooklyn, I smacked 'Ginny' Russo outta the ring, September 14, 1923 -- same night Firpo knocked Dempsey outta the ring. But who got the Press?  He did. He had a manager -- September 14, 1923.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya got a good mind for dates. Mickey deafly continues, becoming more engrossed every se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this face -- twenty- one stitches over the left eye, thirty-four over the right -- my nose was busted seventeen times, the last being the Sailor Mike fight New Year's Eve, 1940, in Camden, New Jersey -- What a professional pastin' I give him.  Here, read about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shows a tiny press clipping; points to cauliflower ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An' he give me the vegetable on the ear.  I got pain an' experience... an' you got heart -- kinda remind me of Marciano, ya do. Rocky points to his most prized possession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody ever said that -- There's his picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, ya kinda remind me of the Rock.  Ya move like 'im. Mickey has rung the bell.  Nothing could please Rocky mor than being compared to his idol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya got heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart, but I ain't got no Tocker. Rocky shifts against the wall and lowers himself into a crouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, I know this business. Rocky, when I was fightin' it was the dirtiest racket goin', see.  Pugs like me was treated like fightin' dogs -- throw ya in the pit an' for ten bucks ya try to kill each other.  We had no management...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fought in boxcars, in whorehouse basements, any joint with a floor -- October 1931 I fought a bum who put a tack in the thumb of his glove an' punched so many holes in my face I had spit shootin' outta my cheeks -- I never had no manager watchin' out for me -- See that picture outside the gym -- 'Mighty Mick,' that's me in my prime.  I had all the tools.  I coulda starched any lightweight husky on the East Coast -- But I had no management.  Nobody ever got to know how slick I was, but I had a head for business an' stashed a few bucks an' opened the gym -- It's a dirt hole, I know it, but that an' a lotta scars is what I got to show for fifty years in the business, kid -- now you come along with this shot an' I feel like it's me gettin' the shot I never got... Yeah, we was treated like dogs -- like them Dago's, no offense, in the Colosseum in Rome there -- An' now I got all this knowledge, I wanna give it to ya so I can protect ya an' make sure ya get the best deal ya can! Rocky rises and opens a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Respect, I always dished ya respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ya gave Dipper my locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost begging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I -- I made a mistake.  Kid, I'm askin' man to man.  I wanna be ya manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fight's set -- I don't need a manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you can't buy what I know.  Ya can't.  I've seen it all!  I got pain an' I got experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got pain an' experience too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever I got, I always got on the slide.  This shot's no different.  I didn't earn nothin' -- I got it on the slide... I needed ya help about ten years ago when I was startin', but ya never helped me none. Mickey drops the ashtray and kneels to pick it up... He remains on one knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If ya was wantin' my help, why didn't ya ask?  Just ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked, but ya never helped nothin'! -- Like the Bible sez, ya don't get no second chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, I'm seventy-six years old.  Maybe you can be the winner I never was -- your shot is my last shot! Rocky is choked and goes into the bathroom and closes the door. Mickey struggles to his feet and, like a beaten man, leav Several moments later Rocky steps out and lowers himself into bed.  Springing up a second later, he runs outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky races up the block toward the shadowy and hunched f of Mickey.  Way in the distance, we SEE Rocky stop the ol man beneath a street lamp.  He places an arm around his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following morning, Rocky's ALARM CLOCK GOES OFF at exactly four A.M.  Not accustomed to rising this early, w great difficulty Rocky staggers to his feet and wavers to the bathroom.  He turns the light on and roaches scatter. At the top of the mirror hang the telegrams.  Rocky fills the basin and submerges his face in cold water. Rocky sways to the icebox and removes a dozen eggs.  He cracks five raw eggs into a glass and downs it in one swill... his body quivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky steps outside.  He is dressed in a well-worn sweat suit with a hood, gloves and sneakers.  It is pitch dark his steaming breath attests to the cold. He begins running down the center of the deserted street. He can only be clearly SEEN as his form passes beneath th street lamps. Two garbage men stop hoisting cans to watch him pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky stands at the base of an overwhelmingly steep fligh of stairs.  He stares up at the stairs that nearly disapp into the morning gray.  Taking a deep breath, he starts u From the start, he looks out of shape and halfway up his legs give way.  Standing, he brushes off and descends the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky passes City Hall and veers to the river.  He pauses heaving great gusts of exhausted breaths.  He throws seve lazy jabs in the air and walks awhile with hands on his aching sides.  Men delivering the morning papers observe with amusement. Rocky forces himself to begin running again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading along Spring Garden Street, Rocky passes beneath elevated train station.  The ROARING TRAIN overhead seems blend perfectly with his muscular running style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is beginning to lighten.  The fighter now runs al the piers and past anchored freighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is five-thirty and Rocky approaches the loading platfo belonging to Eastern Packing Company.  Alongside the load platform come several boxcars. Rocky mounts the ramp and knocks on the metal door.  It s opens and Paulie guides him inside.  Paulie is drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya feelin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got whiskey here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No. Rocky notices TWO PUERTO RICANS lounging alongside theshi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the guy who's fightin' Apollo Creed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck -- Kill him, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as though rehearsed badly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hip -- Hip -- Hooray!  C'mon -- Hip -- Hip --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walks away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooray, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock'll be comin' by every mornin' to pick up some Prime -- can't train on that store crap. Rocky smiles and Paulie leads him out of the office and t the large metal door of a walk-in refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.  The freezer resembles a modern torture chamb row after row of hanging slabs of beef stretch into the darkness to the far end of the refrigerator.  The blower overhead causes the men to speak loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If ya don't pay Gazzo, ya end up hangin' on the hook, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gazzo's a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout you talk to 'em about me? (tightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please do me that favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep this job, ya eat better. Paulie opens a jackknife and idly jabs the hanging meat. swills whiskey from a pint bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, d'ya think you an' my sister -- Ah, doin' good together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't sure, what's the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The story -- what's happenin'? Paulie speaks like a man who has been mulling this over f quite a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya really like her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the attraction?  I don't see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno -- she fills gaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs and takes meat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got gaps.  I got gaps -- together we fill the gaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ballin' her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk dirty 'bout ya sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tersely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, ya screwin' her? From across the room Rocky looks him hard in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I can't put ya together with Gazzo, cause ya talk too much -- big mouth. Paulie reddens.  He steps forward and slams his fists in hanging beef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The punching of the beef is a muted challenge and Rocky responds. Rocky walks up to a beef and slams his fist into the ribs The grotesque object swings in a wide arc like a hanging corpse.  Rocky moves to the next one and hooks. Rocky's face reveals a never before seen concentration, a though he were locked in total battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit the rump.  The rump! Ya'll break the ribs! Rocky speeds up and continues pounding on the second row beef.  Paulie's eyes widen and his face grimaces with eve punch, like he were receiving it.  Rocky moves into the d recess of the refrigerator.  Only the dull SOUNDS of his POUNDING FISTS can be HEARD. Rocky works his way to Paulie again.  Every hanging beef swings and appears surrealistically alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do that to Creed an' they'll take us to jail for murder. Rocky looks at his hands.  They are drenched in red up to the elbows with beef blood. Paulie hands him a package of beef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk dirty 'bout ya sister. Rocky takes the package and runs out.  Paulie's bleary ey reveal a fearful respect and slight resentment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym is filled to capacity.  The NOISE is DEAFENING. Rocky pounds a heavy bag. Mickey steps forward and removes a piece of string from h pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passionate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  Stop!  I can't stand it! It's clumsy.  You're off balance. He motions to his bullish helper, Mike.  He hands him the string.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie it to both ankles -- Leave two feet slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never had good footwork. Mike completes the task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the footwork -- You're off balance.  The legs are sticking everywhere.  Marciano had the same problem, an' the string cured it.  When you can hit and move without breakin' the string you'll have balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be a very dangerous person. Two young boys in street clothes interrupt Mickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, could we have your autograph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you boys ever interrupt when I'm conductin' business, or I'll kill you both -- Go away. The boys depart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Autographs!  Ya wanna be a writer or a fighter?  Let's work. Mike looks off across the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... we got visitors. Mickey strains his eyes to see a group of REPORTERS and N CAMERAMEN entering his gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cameraman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set the camera up over there. (to Mickey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're from Channel Seven -- Covering the pre-fight training.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I own the place. The Reporter has a hundred things on his mind... he turns from Mickey and nods to his crew... the other television crews rush to set up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here at Goldmill's Gym -- A Philadelphia landmark of sorts since 1929 -- The stench of toil permeates every corner.  The sweat a trademark of a unique profession... Yet, the most unique fixture is an unprecedented 50 to 1 underdog heavyweight named, Rocky Balboa. The camera turns to Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mickey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I do this? Mickey nods and Rocky faces the glaring lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much has happened lately -- Has it changed your life style much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... People talk to me more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you preparing for this Bicentennial bout? A young punchy fighter yells out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Readin' fuckin' history books, man! The gym explodes with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flushed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can cut that out later. Apollo Creed says he'll let you stay three rounds before he puts you away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (honestly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo's a great fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel you have a chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe -- He faces Mickey.  Mickey whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tear his head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have anything derogatory to say about the Champion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derogatory?  Yeah, he's great. Apollo Creed and his entourage enter the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bellowing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the Champion of the whole world!!! The gym freezes... everyone turns and stares in wondermen Mickey Goldmill shakes his head in disbelief.  He now realizes it is a publicity stunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) (approaching Rocky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Italian Stallion, I come over to tell you to be very smart an' after this fight donate what's gonna be left of your body to science, cause after this fight what's left won't fill a tuna fish can!... So beware, Mon Cher!!! Apollo turns to the cameras... Rocky is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This classic fight -- Tha's right, this bicentennial fight's goin' down in the history books 'cause January first I'm gonna be the first man to bounce another man offa the planet Pluto! Dipper stands in the far ring... the attention Rocky is receiving makes him a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I gots a special announcement, y'hear.  For the first time in alotta years this championship fight is gonna be on your home T.V.! Free -- 'Course that's just for Philly -- My present to the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now some ya'll ain't much on likin' me, but ya gotta admit Apollo Creed is one DAMN generous, 100% pure, government inspected, Afro-American Folk Hero!!! Everyone laughs... Dipper moves across the room like a la snake.  He brushes people aside and steps behind Rocky. nudges him... Rocky thinks it is an accident and ignores Dipper pushes harder and Rocky looks questioningly at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya nothin', Boy! Apollo stops his sales pitch in mid-sentence... The television crew faces Dipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say ya nothin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happenin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happenin'!  This pig is takin' my shot -- I iz a contender.  He's nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbstruck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo', Dipper, why're ya --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his fist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spar me in front of these here TV dudes -- I knock ya ass to Jersey! Dipper's fat black trainer holds out his hands and Dipper slaps them soul style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dipper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can forget about sparring, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo' know I iz the best man here!  Yo' said so yoself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost apologetically to the crew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why let Rocky here take a chance on cuttin' or breakin' a hand? -- Take a shower, Dipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mouth me, old man, I'll knock yo' out too.  C'mon, wop, spar me, let everybody see who's got the heat around here. Silence looms over the gym... Apollo is apprehensive.  Th scene is becoming too real.  The frightened television cr slyly begins putting away their expensive equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; insanely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, yo' best keep them cameras out!  Fight me, boy! Let Creed here see the kind of punk he's fightin'! Mike forces his way through the crowd and stands behind R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't chance it, man -- He's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gettin' outta hand -- Rocky will fight in the ring January first, not here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo' yellow, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yellow, cautious. (to the crew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, it's very easy for a fighter to accidentally hurt -- Dipper suddenly steps forward and slaps Rocky very hard across the side of the head... The gym becomes stone cold Dipper is in total command and enjoying every moment of i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If yo're afraid to fight me, then get down an' kiss my feet, boy. Mickey looks nervously around and knows it's only seconds before the blood will run... Rocky stands motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a walk, Rock. Please, don't take a chance. He wants to hurt you so you can't fight. Rocky swallows his pride.  He still has the string around his ankles.  He starts to shuffle away with Mickey... Dip steps forward and viciously slaps Rocky again. Mike jumps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you tryin' to cut 'im, man! Back off, scumbag, or I'll bite your face! Dipper cuts loose with a hook and knocks Mike flat.  The room reeks of fear... Apollo's eyes flick back and forth between Rocky and Dipper.  Apollo taps his bodyguards and they begin to ease away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Now, boy, kiss my feet. Rocky eyes his friend lying on the floor.  He shuffles forward and stands before Dipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; almost in a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Kiss 'em. Rocky looks at Mickey, then lowers his eyes to Dipper's feet... Dipper smiles.  Rocky starts to bend towards the shoes.  Without warning, he explodes with a pair of combinations into Dipper's exposed ribs.  A CRACK is HEAR and Dipper sinks to the floor writhing in pain... The roo is silent except for Dipper's moaning. Apollo is stunned by the scene.  The gym has become a ver gloomy place.  He eyes Rocky with admiration and a hint o apprehension... He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey is the first one to shake off the chill... He shak his fists at the Reporters, and puts his arm around Rocky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid's got cannons -- Print that. The crowd disperses, leaving Dipper a pathetic and broken figure lying on a dirty gym floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the dismal apartment... On the floor are at le ten telegrams.  Rocky scoops them up and tosses them asid Next to the door is a pile of over a hundred telegrams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you open them anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They either say, 'Kill the nigger' or 'Hope you die, Honky.' -- What ya got in the bag? Adrian steps to the window.  She pulls a pair of short bu lovely curtains from a shopping bag... The colorful curta glare in the dark room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharp -- Real nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really -- You don't think they're overly feminine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Sharp -- You look great. Adrian smiles and pulls out a small Christmas wreath... Rocky smiles.  His eyes show what he feels for this woman

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian, you really look great, y'know -- But I can't fool around durin' trainin' -- makes the legs weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't want weak legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't fool around -- You look very great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... But I think weak legs ain't bad sometimes, y'know. Rocky approaches in a seductive manner.  Adrian uncharacteristically removes her sweater.  Underneath is T-shirt that reads "Win, Rocky, Win."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it might be cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya right -- (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mebbe we best just hold hands -- the shirt made me feel guilty, y'know. SCENE FADES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky is running... for extra weight he carries his huge dog, Butkus.  After a half a block he sags under the weig and laughing, begins to wrestle with the dog on the pavement... Rocky tries to sneak away from the dog, but after a few steps the beast sees him and chases him down street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is early morning and as usual Rocky jogs to the meatho He is followed by his new dog, Butkus.  He is stopped sho when he notices several television news vans parked out f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and the dog enter the freezer area and see several reporters and men with mini-cameras milling around... Pau is waiting for him -- Rocky is upset and goes outside. Paulie follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Rock.  I made a few phone calls an' thanks to me ya goin' to be a big man -- Thatta dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta these guys want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see ya train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, what's with you? -- It was suppose to be private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was doin' ya a favor -- C'mon inside -- Y'know, my sister really likes ya. Rocky follows Paulie inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPORTER points in Rocky's direction and suddenly he is surrounded and led into the freezer area and positioned beside a slab of hanging beef.  The camera lights go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax, Mr. Balboa -- (to the camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today we're here with heavyweight challenger, Rocky Balboa.  The reason we are standing in a refrigerated box is that Mr. Balboa has an unusual method of training and in a moment he is going to demonstrate it for our viewing audience -- But first, Rocky, how did you ever come to train in an icebox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah -- My buddy Paulie let me in one day an' I hit the beef here an' liked it -- An' since I become a challenger, the owner don't mind neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a common training method -- I mean do other fighters pound raw meat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think me and Paulie invented it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you give us a demonstration? Rocky steps over to a hanging beef and begins pounding wi incredible intensity... Everyone present is taken aback. Rocky completes hitting the meat and stands there with hi hands dripping beef blood. The Commentator is unnerved and Rocky looks straight into the camera lens and holds up his bloody fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Diane Lewis in the meathouse with the Southpaw, Rocky Balboa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo sits behind Jergens' desk.  Jergens is not present Four middle-aged and younger types and Creed's lawyer sit around the desk.  The desk is flowing with forms and char

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is being channeled into West Coast closed-circuit advertising?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it four hundred an' fifty. (to younger man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send two hundred roses to the mayor's wife from me, get a picture an' make sure it gets all the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do ya want to run the fifteen radio spots in the mid-west? I think you could spend the money better in Canadian publicity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd like to get Canada -- see, if we can get a tax break -- Gimme the figures on the Program Concession. Meanwhile, the trainer sits across the room in a darkened corner looking at a small television.  He is watching Rocky's bloody exhibition on the news... He waves at Apollo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo, you oughta come see this boy you're gonna fight on TV -- looks like he means business. Apollo is still engrossed in his paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean business, too -- (to men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gross rental of the arena is gonna include the four hundred ushers, right? -- Gimme some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a moonless night and Paulie staggers across the str and enters his building... He staggers up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie removes his coat and tosses it listlessly in a chair... He rubs his red eyes and sways into the kitchen. He takes a bottle of wine out of the icebox.  As he swill the wine he hears the SOUND of Rocky's and Adrian's VOICE traveling from his sister's room.  Paulie's face tightens and he staggers towards the bedroom. He stands outside the bedroom door and peers through a crack... Rocky, Adrian, and the dog are watching TV in th otherwise darkened room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And he called the reporters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Threw my whole day off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be mad at him -- He just wants to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo -- I ain't mad.  I'm just outta joint when reporters are around -- They take cheap shots an' Paulie knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Are you going to say anything to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What's to say?  I dunno what he wants from me -- Filled with uncontrollable anger, Paulie smashes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'!  I want nothin' from you!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutup!  I want nothin' -- I ain't no charity case!  Get outta my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't no friend no more -- Go home!  Outta my house I want ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk like that to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta my life both of ya's. Paulie kicks the door out of frustration and appears to b bordering on a nervous breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outta my house I want ya!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's cold outside, Paulie. Paulie goes to the living room closet and removes a baseb bat... Rocky and Adrian quickly follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want ya messin' up my sister no more -- He's scum from the corner, I don't raise ya to hang with no bum! Adrian is speechless... Rocky moves towards Paulie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; raising the bat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Wanna hit on me?  C'mon -- C'mon, I'll break both ya arms so's they never work... Rocky freezes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Paulie.  Stop now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want 'im outta here -- (to Rocky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think I'm good enough to work for Gazzo? (spits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I think of bums like you an' Gazzo! (spits again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goin' up an' don't care enough to throw Paulie some crumbs! (spits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give ya meat, an' I give ya my sister, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a pig would say that! Paulie smashes a small table with the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Adrian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forget what I went through to give ya the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave me what?!  Knots! You gave me knots in here every day -- you made me scared of everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always seen ya had the best, but did ya ever think of puttin' in a good word for me with this scumbag! Paulie smashes a large lamp with the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me -- I could never even get married 'cause you couldn't live by yaself -- ya'd die by yaself!  So instead I put you two together -- Did ya think of puttin' in a good word for me? -- You owe me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owe you what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me an' are supposed to treat me good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good?  Good, Paulie?!  I've been treatin' you like a baby. Since I can't remember it's so long -- I'm the only one who feeds you an' puts you in bed when ya can't stand up -- and it's you that made me feel like a loser -- That's what ya use to call me 'Loser' -- What kind of name is that?  So can ya blame me for not remembering to talk about you when I'm with Rocky -- I don't owe you, Paulie, you owe me. The brother flares up and threatens Adrian with the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You busted?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a virgin? -- Ya let 'im in ya pants, didn't ya!  Ya pulled down ya pants an' let him have it, didn't ya!! Mortified, Adrian runs to her room... Rocky steps to Paul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fuming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- Paulie cocks the bat back and tenses... Rocky remains sti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I can't haul meat no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, I been beggin' ya for a break until I'm sick inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What break?  Huh?  What break! Who am I to give breaks!  I'm a fighter, you haul meat.  You do what you do an' I do what I do best -- that's it -- that's life, man! Paulie looks ashamed... Rocky walks, then returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... An' what ya said to my girlfriend ain't right -- Do it again, I'll kill ya. Rocky goes into the bedroom... Adrian has buried her face a pillow... She is rocking slightly.  Rocky cradles her a kisses her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna hear a dirty joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey is in his cluttered office above the gym... the ro is dark.  Blankets are tacked over the windows.  Rocky is watching 8 mm movies of Apollo Creed in action... Rocky watches with intense concentration as the fighter moves l a huge dancer around the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His defense is great, can't lie 'bout that -- You have a rollin' style.  Can't retreat as fast -- But your style ain't retreatin'. They both watch the flickering images.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how he plays sometimes -- Drives his cornermen nuts. Nobody knows his next move -- Him included. They watch more action... Creed has a fighter helpless against the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killer instinct -- Ya both got the killer touch.  Interestin'. See that! -- Right-cross combination.  Beautiful.  But you got the power to rip the body. They watch more action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, when ya climb into the square, an' know ya' meetin' the best fighter in the world, ya' gonna be ready, ya' gonna be ready 'cause I been waitin' for fifty years -- Fifty years. When I'm done with you, you'll gonna be able to spit nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll gonna be able to eat lightin' and crap thunder -- You'll be a very, very dangerous person... The SCENE FADES on Mickey's voice and Rocky staring transfixed at the images projecting on the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky is pounding the heavy bag with intense concentratio As he strikes from all angles, Mickey instructs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky now works on the incline situp board... While doing situps, he pounds himself in the stomach with a dumbbell. The pain is evident on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushups between two chairs as Mike sits on his shoulders. Mickey coaching drives him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike has on a pair of target gloves and Rocky moves aroun the ring swinging at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drenched in sweat, Rocky hums the speed bag.  His express is hard and flushed.  Mickey clicks a stopwatch and pats Rocky's shoulder... He is very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky has just completed exercising with the medicine bal Dino hands him a towel... Paulie crosses the gym as Rocky heads to the steam room... A thin man crosses the gym and Mickey nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What cha say, Benny -- Meet 'The Rock.' This is our cutman, Benny Stein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Benny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the eyes, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny checks the skin around Rocky's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't bad.  Seen worse -- Cover up an' things should be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a shower. Heading towards the shower, Rocky is intercepted by Pauli who traverses the gym.  He stops Rocky at the shower room entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Rock, I think I found an angle to make some bread usin' ya name, ya mind? Exhausted, Rocky studies Paulie's face a moment and nods 'yes.'... Rocky sways into the shower room and Paulie strides off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running... Rocky's crowd of trailing boys has tripled. Dashing through the streets, he resembles the Pied Piper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is twilight and Rocky is alone at the very bottom of a huge flight of steps that seem to stretch into the heaven Rocky takes a deep breath and sprints up the never-ending stairs... Halfway up, his body shows the strain.  Nearing the top, Rocky pumps with all his strength and arrives at the very top... He looks down the steep stairs and swells with pride... He is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky is led into Mayor Rizzo's office by an aide... Rock is very nervous as he approaches the mayor, who is seated behind his wide desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Rocky. Flips open a thick file that lays in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been going over your record -- You've been the busy type -- (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineteen arrests -- probation three times -- expelled from seven public schools in 1964 and '65. Rocky tries to sink into the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a very busy man, but I just wanted to remind you that you'll be setting an example for thousands of guys like yourself and maybe start them off in a new direction and give our police force a break -- I also hope you try your very best and bring pride to Philadelphia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'll try. The mayor presses a button and a photographer enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you stand up, please. Rocky rises and the mayor shakes his hand... Their pictur is taken three times... The photographer exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming by, Rocky -- good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... After the fight you'll have nearly a hundred and fifty thousand dollars -- What do you plan to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Run for mayor. The mayor is shocked at first but then breaks into a big, friendly laugh, and Rocky exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian and Rocky are at his apartment.  They are looking new scrapbooks.  Newsweek Magazine: Headline: "The Italia Stallion or Donkey?" -- Philadelphia Magazine -- Rocky stands with the mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, do you realize everybody in this country knows your face, and after the fight everybody in the world is going to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... She flips through Sports Illustrated, The American Sports Ring Magazine, World Boxing, True, and a multitude of oth clippings. The TELEPHONE RINGS... Rocky rises and walks to the new white object hanging on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first call... Hello?  Yeah, speakin' -- Who is this? Bruce?  Bruce who? -- Yo, Bruce!  How ya been?  I ain't seen ya for nine or eight years -- Yeah, things is great, how's things with you upstate -- Ya sellin' real estate, hey, that's a good job... Yeah, I gotta advance, but I bought ringside seats for the guys at the gym.  I get the hundred an' fifty grand after the fight... Adrian overhears the statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah, I know it's a lotta money -- Condominiums?  Nobody uses them anybody.  Listen, I think a pet shop is a good investment, y'know -- I don't care 'bout long hours -- there's no depreciation -- that don't matter none to me -- Yeah, I like animals. Why don't ya give me ya number an' I'll call ya back?  Lemme getta pencil -- Rocky makes no motion to get a pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what is it -- four- twelve 659-2424.  Yeah, yeah, thanks for callin' -- Sure I'll get back to ya, Bruce -- see ya. Rocky hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that you said about a pet shop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say about a pet shop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want ya cleanin' nobody else's cages no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go out for a while. Rocky grabs his coat and moves to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to dog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky arrives at Goldmill's Gym... He unlocks the gym's d Rocky and the dog move through the eerie shadows of the g Rocky moves across the gym with his dog and moves up the steps to Mickey's office... At the top of the stairs he looks down at the ring, reflects for a moment, then enter the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After turning on the lights, he quickly cleans the clutte desk and sets up the projector... He goes to the cabinet removes a stack of 16 mm films.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office clock indicates it is several hours later.  Ro is engrossed in watching another Apollo Creed film.  He s motionless. Rocky sits upright.  Something catches his eyes... He springs at the projector.  He reruns the scene several ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several hours later Rocky is engrossed in watching anothe Apollo Creed film... He sits motionless.  Something catch his eye.  Rocky stops the projector as Apollo is deliveri a knockout blow to an unfortunate opponent. Rocky moves right up to freeze frame and inspects it like was a priceless painting... He backs off and begins writi on a note pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first light of dawn streams through Mickey's filthy windows... Rocky is slumped in a chair and it is apparent has lost interest in watching the movies. The film has completed its run through the projector and lazily flops around on the top reel... Listlessly Rocky r his reddened eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Mickey flips on the light... The two m stare at each other for a long moment.  Mickey studies Rocky's despondent expression and knows what is on the fighter's mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I know what you're thinkin'm kid -- At least ya gotta shot -- All ya can do is try ya' best. Rocky stands and, with his dog, inches past Mickey and ex the room.  Mickey walks over and turns off the projector. He idly pushes the machine with a lazy motion until it slides off the desk and crashes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After leaving Mickey's gym, Rocky and his dog listlessly move down the street and head for home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky arrives at his apartment... Adrian is asleep on the couch.  He lowers himself beside her.  Her eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I can't beat him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can't beat him. Adrian touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been watchin' the movies -- studyin' -- He ain't weak nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Rocky -- you worked so hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't so bad, 'cause I was a nothin' before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, it's true -- But that don't bother me -- I just wanna prove somethin' -- I ain't no bum... It don't matter if I lose... Don't matter if he opens my head... The only thing I wanna do is go the distance -- That's all. Nobody's ever gone fifteen rounds with Creed.  If I go them fifteen rounds, an' that bell rings an' I'm still standin', I'm gonna know then I weren't just another bum from the neighborhood... Adrian touches Rocky's face... The fighter gently lowers himself beside his woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No foolin' around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the night of the Bicentennial fight... The location the Philadelphia Spectrum. The Spectrum is filling to capacity... Grandly dressed celebrities and wealthy fight fans lower themselves into their ringside seat.  Nearly everyone is holding a red, white, and blue sweater... The arena is decorated in tons of patriotic red, white an blue.  High above the ring are huge posters of GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: FRANKLIN - and APOLLO CREED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo Creed sits in his dressing room... It is dead sile except for some NOISE that filters under the door from th arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a CLOSE-UP of Apollo's hand being taped... The RASP SOUND of the adhesive tape is very pronounced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The atmosphere is identical to Apollo's dressing room. Adrian watches in silence as Mike wraps Rocky's hand. Again, the most pronounced SOUND is the RASPING of the adhesive tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo's other hand is being wrapped.  Dead silence excep for the TAPE and APOLLO'S BREATHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky's other hand is being wrapped in a CLOSE-UP.  The o SOUND is the TAPE and ROCKY'S mounting BREATHING PATTERN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP of drops being placed in his nose to help increa his intake of oxygen.  The tremendously magnified SOUND o APOLLO TAKING IN AIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP of the drops being placed in Rocky's nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy coating of vaseline is applied around the Champio eyes... In an EXTREME CLOSE-UP, the eyes shine brightly w the grease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grease is smeared around Rocky's eyes... In the EXTREME CLOSE-UP several deep scars are SEEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP of Apollo's trainer digging his fingers deeply i the thick neck muscles of Apollo's upper back and neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP OF Mike's arms wrapped around Rocky's waist and lifting his diaphragm up... Magnified BREATHING ROARS fro the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo's trainer slips a mouthpiece into Apollo's mouth. Apollo shakes his head and the trainer removes it and pla another one in the champ's mouth... Creed nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone present is motionless as Rocky is in the bathroo Alone, Rocky is on his knee praying.  Completing his sile prayer, he stands and looks at himself in the mirror. Suddenly a wave of emotion sweeps over him as he thinks t in a few moments he will face the most overwhelming chall of his life. Out in the dressing room, the door opens and a guard lean in and nods that it is time.  He leaves... Rocky steps ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's time, kid. Rocky nods and moves toward Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'll wait for you here. Rocky nods and she kisses him.  The fighter leaves with h trainers... Adrian is on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, Mickey and Mike start down the long hallway... Up ahead are three security guards... Rocky rubs his bare shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Mick, can I have my rob? Rocky puts on the robe... Embroidered across the back in flaming letters is:

dialogues.speaker: "THE ITALIAN STALLION"
dialogues.text: *Pennzoil*

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike helps him into the robe... Mickey is not amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you care what the people will say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm doin' it for a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you get outta this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the robe an' Paulie gets three grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Shrewd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO RINGSIDE COMMENTATORS sit in front of a panel of clos circuit televisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would like to welcome our viewing audience to the Grand World Championship Bicentennial Heavyweight Fight -- the first major event of the Bicentennial Year... A point of interest is that the fight is being beamed to more than seven hundred and fifty million fans in theatres in nearly every corner of the world.  I would like to welcome an old friend, and co- commentator for this evening's event -- Jimmy Michaels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Bob.  The electricity is everywhere tonight.  Rocky Balboa, a fifty-to-one underdog, is living a Cinderella story which has captured peoples' imaginations all over the world -- to quote a popular sports magazine, 'The fighting style should be 'The Caveman Against the Cavalier.' From the increase in sound it appears the challenger is now approaching the ring... His record is forty-four wins, twenty losses and thirty-eight knockouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only wonder if this man has the skill to go past three rounds -- Vegas odds say, 'no.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wedge of uniformed guards knife down the aisle to the r Many people wish Rocky well as he passes... people also h insults.  From the expression on Mickey's face it is also the greatest night of his life.  In the audience are fami faces from the gym.  From the back of the arena a ROAR go up... Apollo Creed is in a mock boat dressed like George Washington.  He throws silver dollars.  The NOISE builds DEAFENING proportions.  Creed's trainer holds the rope an Creed bounds into the ring.  He tears off the Washington outfit and it is clearly SEEN that Apollo Creed is garbed an outrageous Uncle Sam outfit... On his head is a red, white and blue sequined top hat.  The robe is sequined re white and blue.  His boxing trunks are red, white and blu silk with stars around the waistband.  The boxing shoes match the trunks.  On his chin is a pointed white Uncle S beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could go deaf with the noise -- it undoubtedly means Champion Apollo Creed is heading towards the ring --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I seeing right?  Creed is approaching the ring in a boat. Is he supposed to be George Washington?  Obviously so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been confirmed that it is definitely an impersonation of George Washington -- a great way to start 1976 off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. Immediately Creed begins gracefully dancing in a wide cir He passes within inches of Rocky in his Uncle Sam outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you!  I want you! The crowd loves the taunting.  Apollo Creed floats back t his corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let 'im get you tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta ya think that outfit cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ANNOUNCER steps to the center of the ring... Several in suits stand against the ropes... Paulie is dressed nic and sits at ringside with a pretty blonde escort.  Rocky waves at him.  Paulie waves back and secretly gestures at his date... Rocky smiles and gestures back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen -- Welcome to the Bicentennial Heavyweight Championship Fight... We are very proud to have with us four former Great Champions... Ladies an' gents, 'The one and only 'Manassa Mauler' -- Jack Dempsey!' The CROWD ROARS and JACK DEMPSEY waves and goes to Creed' corner, then Rocky's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, kid. He moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mickey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Jack Dempsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Announcer points and the timekeeper RINGS the BELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Former Middleweight Champion -- 'The Bronx Bull' -- Jake LaMotta! JAKE LA MOTTA raises his fist and gives best wishes to bo contenders... Timekeeper RINGS the BELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man with the big punch -- Everybody's favorite, 'The Brown Bomber ' -- Joe Louis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE LOUIS bows and steps to Creed's corner.  Creed strike boxing pose and Louis tosses a playful punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must be friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, last but certainly not least -- the former Heavyweight Champion, a son of Philly, Smoking Joe Frazier! FRAZIER rumbles to the center of the ring.  The CROWD CHE Apollo puts on a show... He grimaces and gestures like he going to attack Frazier.  His cornermen hold him back.  T laugh.  Frazier goes to Rocky's corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save some of him for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commentators beckon to Frazier as he exits the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The former champ looks great -- Can we get Joe over here -- here he comes. Joe Frazier stands in front of the Commentators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, what are your feelings about tonight's fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think any man who works an' trains hard always gotta chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look in great shape, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always in shape. Joe laughs and exits.  The timekeeper RINGS the BELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Now for the evening's main event -- In the corner to my right, The Challenger, wearing white trunks -- At one hundred an' ninety-one pounds, one of Philly's own sons -- 'The Italian Stallion,' Rocky Balboa! A good CROWD RESPONSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the far corner, wearing red, white an' blue -- Weighing in at two hundred and ten pounds -- Undefeated in forty- six fights -- the Heavyweight Champion of the World -- 'The Master of Disaster' -- Apollo Creed! The arena EXPLODES and Creed puts on a display of hand sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REFEREE motions to both fighters... They step to the center of the ring.  As the Referee explains the rules Apollo and Rocky stare hard into each other's eyes... The Referee's voice fades and the fighters' expressions fill screen... Something soulful and frightening is being communicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Now come out fighting. The fighters return to their corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless ya, Rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mick -- I'm gonna try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELL RINGS... Creed dances forward and boxes Rocky as though he considers the man an amateur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Champ stings the slower challenger with jabs at will -- Balboa blocks eighty percent of the blows with his face -- Creed doesn't look the best he's ever been but is moving smoothly -- Creed snaps out a triple combination that backs Balboa into a corner -- oh, a solid hook by Creed, a master of fist-men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Champion is smiling and toying with the man -- trying to give the fans their money's worth and make a show of it with the badly out-classes challenger -- Another left to right combination.  I feel sorry for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creed is down!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky suddenly explodes with an upswing hook to the jaw. Creed is dropped.  The arena EXPLODES.  Creed's eyes show disbelief.  So do Rocky's. Rocky backs into his corner... Mickey and Mike yell at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it!  Goddamnit, you got the power!  The body, get the body!!!  Ya got him goin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six!... Seven!... Eight!... Creed is up... His playful attitude is gone... he is now business.  His lightning jab stings Rocky's face repeated

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Come at me, sucker! Rocky charges and a terrific right crashes against Apollo chin, followed by an uppercut to the liver that causes Cr to cringe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo counters with jabs and Rocky whips brutal combinat to the body. The BELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how fast he is -- damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe deep -- Keep ya chin down!!  Use the legs and drive through 'im.  Attack -- Attack -- Attack!

dialogues.speaker: APOLLO'S CORNER
dialogues.text: Apollo does not sit.  He stands and clowns with the spectators to prove he is not hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Trainer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That boy damn near broke my arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure -- He can hit -- Don't play no more -- Stick an' move, hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll carry him 'till the third.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play with this man, he's fightin' hard -- Let 'em feel some real heat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELL for the second round RINGS... Rocky rushes out f and furious.  Apollo melts out a left hook that raises a goose egg over Rocky's eye... Apollo employs footwork tha dazzles Rocky.  He has class.  He studies Rocky and emplo his lightning jab with cutting accuracy. Still Rocky shuf ahead, bombarding Creed's midsection with hooks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The round ends with Apollo assaulting Rocky with blinding combinations and delivering a stupendous right cross that flings Rocky into the ropes and shatters his nose... The round ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo stands in his corner and jokes with the fans, but is beginning to show the strain from the body punches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I rearranged his face with that right -- The people love what's happenin' tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People nothin', you in a fight, my man, -- ya best believe what you hear... Knock that boy out soon an' let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky sits as Mickey and Benny try to reduce the swelling around his eyes... The nose is shattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya nose is broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!  How's it look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hardly tell.  Don't swallow the blood -- Go for his ribs.  Don't let 'im breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The guy's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't ya tell 'im you're a fan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commentators are caught up in the action.  They speak rapidly into their microphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had asked anyone who knows boxing, they never would've predicted a first round knockdown and the second round punishment to the body of the Champion... Most fighters will tell you, receiving a good body punch is the next worst thing to dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round three ready to start and should be interesting to see if Creed can put the challenger away -- there goes the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round three... Apollo comes out dancing.  He skips and si steps Rocky's sledgehammer hooks.  An expert ring general Apollo uses the ring fully.  Rocky keeps tearing in and Creed meets the bombing attack that cause thick swelling. Near the end of the round Rocky fires a penetrating punch the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apollo almost sprints out of his corner -- feints and throws a pair of left-right combinations.  Balboa drops beneath a left upper cut and lands a very solid shot on Creed's temple -- not much movement from Balboa, duck a left, a right, another left and explodes with a right hook to the temple -- I mean explodes.  The Champ backs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way Apollo expected this kind of hitting power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way -- but the brilliant ability of the Champion to master situations like this is one of his most outstanding traits -- Creed tosses a perfect right hand that rocks Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creed on the offensive -- Balboa takes the punishment and counters with a left flush over the heart... that hurt. The wallop knocks Apollo off balance... The CAMERA GOES T STEEP ANGLE SHOT from the floor, VERTICALLY UP Apollo's b The SCENE GOES INTO SLOW MOTION... Rocky releases a terrifying uppercut that opens a gash under Creed's eye. Creed's face contorts with excruciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover your face!  Cover up! (to Assistant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My man's cut, my man's bleedin' -- Get ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELL SOUNDS.  Apollo's corner works frantically to cl the wound... The ring DOCTOR inspects the cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad?  Talk to me, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep, but passable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at Rocky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That man's takin' his job too serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's movin' to your left -- don't let him no more -- dance and stick, hear?  Don't play -- I know what ya feelin', but don't play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck!  You fightin' a crazy man -- but you got him hurt bad. (to Assistant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More ice, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky's face is in very bad shape, not cut, but wretchedl swollen around the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you holdin' up, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine... That guy's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme the water!  Ya getttin' tagged with his right.  I think you should feint left and high hook 'im -- Benny, check the eyes!  Can ya see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya sappin' his strength -- He's losin' steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't losin' nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep on him -- You're doin' great.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: In the next ten rounds, Apollo cuts and slashes Rocky to ribbons, but pays dearly... Both his eyes and lips are cu Welts across his midsection attest to Rocky's body-batter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian is unable to remain alone... She is lured by the GROWING ROAR OF THE FANS... She exits the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping out of the dressing room she walks down the corr The MOUNTING CHEERS make her speed up.  She opens the doo at the end of the corridor and is hit by a THUNDEROUS WAV OF SOUND.  The guard at the door inspects her and goes ba to watching the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian stands at the rear of the arena and watches the battle.  She is entranced by the power of it all. Back in the ring, Rocky keeps grinding ahead.  He plants thumping left over the Champion's heart and Creed winces. Rocky is game but losing. At ringside Paulie is frantic... He is living the fight f his seat. Mr. Gazzo and his Bodyguard watch from the second row. Gazzo looks proud.  The Bodyguard, impassive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge and lively crowd look up at the television over th bar... They see Rocky driving Creed against the ropes and cheer loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The Rock's got real stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are fighting with appalling tenacity.  Rocky rips and tears into the body... Apollo counters with a ceasele stream of rapier-like lefts... The Challenger is seriousl outclassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- Lemme cut yo'! Rocky wades in and Creed employs incredible footwork.  He sets himself and cuts loose with a thunderbolt right cros to Rocky's already broken nose.  Blood sprays from the wo and red droplets drip from his chin... Rocky takes a merciless beating and is staggered by a torrent of combinations.  Rocky's eyes are closed.  But Creed cannot drop him... The BELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commentators shift in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a doubt this is the most punishing brawl I have ever seen -- The ringside audience is spotted with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fight should have been stopped rounds ago but Rocky Balboa refuses to fall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only has he refused to fall, but he has beaten the Champion's body without mercy and the bout has become a vicious slugfest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
